settings.pd-heading: Does my monthly price ever go up?
settings.pd-desp: Our pricing isn‚Äôt a flashy promotional rate - it‚Äôs fair and transparent from the start. Over time, there may be minor adjustments to ensure you continue receiving top-notch service. But don‚Äôt worry - we‚Äôre talking about just a dollar or two per year at most. No surprises, just straightforward savings. Plus, you can purchase the equipment at any time, giving you ultimate savings and flexibility.

Moving? No problem. Our Go Flex plan is fully transferable to the next homeowner, allowing them to seamlessly pick up where you left off. Just let us know 30 days before your move, and we‚Äôll handle the rest. We‚Äôre here to make your move hassle-free, just the way it should be.

settings.pd-heading: What is the warranty with my purchase?
settings.pd-desp: With the Go Flex Program, you‚Äôre 100% covered‚Äî24/7/365‚Äîfor both parts and labour, including annual maintenance. If you choose to purchase the equipment, you‚Äôll receive the standard manufacturer‚Äôs warranty. Start with the Go Flex Program to enjoy all the benefits we offer, and when you‚Äôre ready, you can purchase the equipment at your convenience.

settings.pd-heading: How long have you been in business?
settings.pd-desp: Go Lime has been keeping homes comfortable since 2011. With over 150,000 customers across Ontario, we‚Äôve spent more than a decade earning the trust of homeowners just like you. Partnering with trusted names like Enbridge, Home Depot, and Walmart, you can count on the Go Lime team to take care of your family.

settings.pd-heading: Is Go Flex a rental, and what is the term?
settings.pd-desp: Go Flex isn‚Äôt a never-ending rental contract. It‚Äôs a game-changer: an industry-first flexible 180-month subscription with an anytime purchase option. Here‚Äôs how it works: 50% of your monthly payment reduces your purchase price, while the other 50% covers 24/7 service, annual maintenance, and unlimited parts and labour coverage. You get all the perks of ownership without the headaches‚Äîand the flexibility to purchase the equipment at any time.

settings.pd-heading: What is a heat pump and how does it work?¬†¬†
settings.pd-desp: A heat pump is a high-efficiency system that can both heat and cool your home. In winter, it extracts heat from the outside air and brings it indoors. In summer, it works in reverse removing heat from inside your home to cool it down.

settings.pd-heading: Can heat pumps work in cold Canadian climates?
settings.pd-desp: Yes, modern cold-climate heat pumps, including models from KingHome and Lennox, are specifically engineered to perform efficiently even in sub-zero temperatures. These systems come with advanced compressors and defrost technology to handle Ontario winters.

settings.pd-heading: Are heat pumps more efficient than furnaces or air conditioners?¬†¬†
settings.pd-desp: Heat pumps are often more energy-efficient because they move heat instead of generating it. This can significantly lower your electricity or gas bills, especially if you‚Äôre switching from baseboard heaters or an older furnace and AC system.We‚Äôve covered the efficiency comparison in more detail in our blog onheat pumps vs furnaces and air conditioners- check it out to see which option is best for your home.

settings.pd-heading: Do I need a backup heating system with a heat pump?¬†¬†
settings.pd-desp: In very cold temperatures, some homes may benefit from a backup heat source, like a high-efficiency gas furnace. Many heat pumps also come with built-in auxiliary heating for extra support when needed.

settings.pd-heading: Do heat pumps provide air conditioning too?¬†
settings.pd-desp: Yes, all heat pumps function as air conditioners in the summer. They remove indoor heat and humidity to keep your home cool and comfortable.

settings.pd-heading: Are there rebates available for installing a heat pump?¬†¬†
settings.pd-desp: Yes, many heat pumps, especially ENERGY STAR¬Æ certified models qualify for rebates in Ontario. Incentives can vary by city and utility provider, so our experts can help you check what‚Äôs available in your area and guide you through the application process.

settings.pd-heading: Can a heat pump help reduce my carbon footprint?¬†
settings.pd-desp: Yes, because they run on electricity and don‚Äôt burn fuel, heat pumps produce fewer greenhouse gas emissions than traditional gas systems. If paired with green energy, they can help make your home much more eco-friendly.
